16 minutes ago, OOM said:

 a 6-core processor 

uhh... why? This is both obvious speculation (touted as specific knowledge) and completely incorrect

KSP is single threaded and clock speed matters more than threads

First, stock ksp 2 should work better than modded ksp 1, on a decent machine.

Second, ksp 2 minimum requirements will probably be higher than (or equal to) recommended for ksp 1.

It's 2020, let's be reasonable. This game is going to be heavy on hardware, no matter how much you lower the graphics settings. 

If this gets the requirements of only, I'm quoting, equivalent of core i5 and 8 gigs of RAM, I'd be more than pleased.

But I can imagine that at least 16gb would be needed. We don't know how the game would utilize the cpu so we don't know if it needs single core power, or multiple cores or...

What if they make KSP2 a mobile app with a micro transaction business model >,<

you never know! Plans change... the silence and delays make sense now! XD
